title: How to Make Olive Oil and Rosemary Grissini

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF.
steps.description: Spread the baking (parchment) paper across the baking tray (sheet).

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients together in the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Use an electric mixer if preferred.

steps.headline: Divide the dough into 20 even pieces.
steps.description: Roll them into long, thin sausages.

steps.headline: Place them evenly across the baking tray (sheet).
Brush each grissini with the extra olive oil.
Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 20 minutes or until the grissini turn a light golden brown.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack, sitting on the tray.

text: Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF. Spread the baking (parchment) paper across the baking tray (sheet). Mix the ingredients together in the mixing bowl. Use an electric mixer if preferred. Knead the dough for 5 minutes.  Divide the dough into 20 even pieces. Roll them into long, thin sausages. Place them evenly across the baking tray (sheet).  Brush each grissini with the extra olive oil.  Sprinkle each grissini with rosemary.  Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 20 minutes or until the grissini turn a light golden brown. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack, sitting on the tray. Finished.
